hypothesis_content.title: Multi-Timeframe Momentum Stack in BULL Regimes
hypothesis_content.statement: During confirmed BULL regimes (confidence > 70%), when BTC shows aligned momentum across 4H, daily, and weekly timeframes (price > all key EMAs and RSI > 50 on each), entering on a pullback to the 4H 20-EMA with bullish order flow provides high-probability trend continuation entries.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In strong bull markets, aligned multi-timeframe momentum indicates sustained institutional buying. Pullbacks to the 4H 20-EMA offer optimal risk/reward entries. Positive CVD confirms the pullback is not driven by aggressive selling.
entry_conditions: BTC regime is BULL with confidence > 70%
Price > 20, 50, 200 EMA on 4H, daily, AND weekly charts
Price pulls back to within 1% of 4H 20-EMA
Cumulative Volume Delta over last 4 hours is positive

exit_conditions.take_profit: Trail stop at 4H 50-EMA (exit when price closes below)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Pullbacks to the 4H 20-EMA in bull markets frequently break lower (stop loss hit rate > 45%), indicating the trend is weaker than structure suggests. Strategy fails in late-cycle bull markets.
